text: The Eurasian Brown Bear (Ursus arctos arctos) is a subspecies of the Brown Bear (Ursus arctos). It is found across northern Eurasia. It is the national animal of many countries including Finland. == Conflict with humans== Bears are known to attack humans for many reasons but actually they avoid attacking. One reason is that if you surprise a bear it is likely to attack. The other one, is that bears enjoy to eat food, which is why people tend to avoid leaving food in the forest where bears are. == Diet == The Eurasian brown bear is a omnivore (which eats everything). For example, they eat: * Ants * Berries * Honey * Meat * Grass (if there is no food) ==Related pages== * Brown Bear Category:Bears Category:Mammals of Asia Category:Mammals of Europe Category:Mammals of Pakistan Category:National symbols of Russia
title: Eurasian brown bear
